title: Physics Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Ask about previous experiences and skill before. After receiving a phone call from the HR, I got a call from the department chief to proceed with the interview. After receiving a phone call from the HR, I got a call from the department chief to proceed with the interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Smooth, on zoom. This was during the pandemic and I didn’t actually meet anyone, face-to-face. I found the scheduling to be smooth and I had a group interview and then individual conversations. It was very low pressure.
Interview Questions: It was a conversation rather than direct questions. They really tried to get to know me as a person and what I was looking for. They also talked a lot about the role.

title: Speciman Processor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward, typical questions. I think they aim to find a good fit and for someone who is looking to jump start a new career. As long as you express interest and career growth, you'd be a good fit.
Interview Questions: What was a time when you required flexibility during the job?

title: Cash Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Marlborough, MA)
Interview Descriptions:
Had an in-person interview that I thought went well, only to be ghosted by both the interviewer and recruiter.
The recruiter could have just sent me a rejection email, instead of ghosting me!
It doesn’t make any sense, if you feel that one isn’t a good fit for a  job, let them know!
Interview Questions:
What’s your greatest strength?

Weakness?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Easy. Talked with manager about floor expectations safety family etc. talked about floor size and what to expect when being on the floor and working. Good pace and fun interview
Interview Questions: Challenges that I have had working

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was via Zoom due to the pandemic and two employers interviewed me. Both were very friendly and comfortable to talk to. They only asked a few of the common interview questions and then the rest was like having a conversation. It was overall a great interview experience.
Interview Questions:
1. Tell us about yourself!
2. Have you ever been in a situation where a patient or patient’s family was unhappy with something ? If so, how did you handle it?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really interesting. They hold interview events where you can sign up and show up at the hospital and meet up with a manager who will ask you interview questions and review your resume in person.
Interview Questions: What are some obstacles you encountered and resolved?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy. Multiple staff members will interview you. Sometimes requires 2-3 interviews. Questions on your resume, experience and why you want to work for the hospital. Overall easy interview process. Able to park on site just get you ticket validated if coming in for an interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself ?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA)
Interview Descriptions: One in person interview, staff was very insightful and the interview itself was conversational. Very professional. Questions were almost all “tell me a time when...” so it’s helpful to draw from clinical experiences.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for someone else.

title: Anesthesiologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter did not respond to my interest for 4 weeks. Interview arranged. I confirmed the night before and the department had no idea is was visiting. Rescheduled for 2 weeks later. I arrived. No agenda. No schedule to meet staff. No coffee. Overall a very unwelcoming experience.
Interview Questions: Do you want to teach in the new residency program?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Laid back, no pressure. Everyone was respectful and honest. Interview lasted about an hour and I got a tour of the facility. All questions were answered. I did interview with more than one person.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a difficult situation with a patient.

title: PA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Fantastic. Very personal and asked good questions and really listened to my answers.  Also did some patient scenarios and gave feedback and what they were looking for.  Asked about a challenge I have faced and I how I overcame it.
Interview Questions: Why this department, how do I learn best, what am I looking for in a position

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process seem to go very well. The team experience
 was very nice and everybody was extremely professional. Thought I had a good chance at the job. Was told that I would hear back either way. But never heard back at all
Interview Questions: What is your overall management style

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Meet with HR and then you get sent over to the managers who then reach back out to HR with a possible offer then you will meet with HR and employee health
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Peabody, MA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was contacted by email by department head for interview.  Met with department head then was hired.  Went to HR office to complete onboarding process.  Did drug Screen and employee health screen.  Am completing orientation then will start lengthy training schedule.  Overall, the interview in itself was challenging but not difficult.
Interview Questions: What would your current employers say about you?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Simple; a few nurse managers  went through a series of questions with me. Was a formal interview but not intimidating at all. All three interviewers were very nice. they do a background check and drug screen (marijuana is allowed tho)
Interview Questions: Tell me one person you consider a mentor to you as a nurse and why

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: the first interview i met with one person and we spoke for about 20 minutes. the second interview was with 3 people and lasted 2 hours. it was overall a longer experience than expected for an entry level position
Interview Questions: why do want to work here? what skills from your past experiences can you use in your new position? where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Associate Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was one to one and on site. The managers were really friendly and asked me about my background and why I was interested in the position. All the question were related to the resume that I had submitted
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: the hiring process was typical for a Registered Nurse.  They went over my resume and told me all about the unit i would be working on.  There were 2 individuals that inquired about my experience and as to why I love Nursing.  They also asked me why I did travel nursing for a while.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years;  Why I decided to become a Nurse; How do I handle a difficult patient.

title: EMR Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was greeted by the head of the IT department then met with 4 others we went over what the position was going t entail and then we went over my qualifications
Interview Questions: What are your skills

title: Supply Chain Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
HR is not professional. 

I got an interview with director and managers. It was a great conversation and people are very nice and professional. 

I got the second interview soon to talk with teams. I prepared a lot and felt excited about this opportunity. Two days before the interview, the HR partner called me suddenly asked me, do you need a sponsorship. I said yes. She said, sorry, I will cancel your next meeting with teams because we don't provide sponsorship. She doesn't reply my email anymore. 

The HR is very unprofessional. She didn't do her homework as an HR. When I applied for the job online, she should notice that I checked box - Need a sponsorship.  The process took two weeks. She wasted both my time and manager's, teams time. 

Anyway, it will be nice to work with supply chain teams. They are professional and excited about their work. It is still a good experience.
Interview Questions: what is your weakness?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The incoming operations manager does phone interviews to screen candidates. Then tells candidates they are not good enough over the phone. Very impersonal. Yet also asked uncomfortable personal questions I thought were inappropriate and didn't relate to the job description.
Interview Questions: If you had to create a job description for yourself, what would it be?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was connected to this job via a staffing agency. The recruiter was very professional and proactive about setting up the 1:1. However, the manager from Lahey was rude and pretentious. It appears that they needed staff a.s.a.p.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Medical Secretaty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: There was no contact from HR about scheduling an interview regarding above position. 2nd online application that I submitted. A call to the hospital HR department to check on status of open position is very frustrating.
Interview Questions: Still waiting for a response to my resume.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Rude, no call back after repeated phone tag. Was not interested in answering questions about the company or compensation - was rushed to have you just go in - felt it was a canned process.
Interview Questions: They didn't ask questions or want you to ask questions - they just wanted you to show up to interview without knowing anything but the posting blurb

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The group of doctors and other professionals were very nice and friendly. They made the entire process calm, easy, and simple to go through. It was an all day event where I met with multiple people so it wears you out a bit but it's definitely worth it when you see the great things the hospital is doing.
Interview Questions: What is you greatest weakness.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a brief interview conducted over the phone and in person. I met with the head of the department for lunch. Most were technical questions about how I might implement the desired program.
Interview Questions: How do you plan to implement this program

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone call from recruiter, then screening with analyst, HR and then hiring manager.  Skype interview with manager, 2nd.  The process was very easy and the manager was very personable.  Talking to an existing analyst to understand background, current and future state was helpful to know if it would be a good fit.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to be trained?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Beverly, MA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was quickly judged by my outfit of choice in the first interview (not with my manager) but as I went to the second interview with my current manager it was much smoother. She was very considerate and caring about her employees.
Interview Questions: Do you see yourself continuing education and/or continuing as a medical assistant?

title: Medical Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very nice manager and welcoming staff. Questions were fairly straight forward. The whole process took about 1.5 hours on the first interview and 45 minutes for the second one. I received an offer about a week and a half after the second interview.
Interview Questions: What is a difficult situation you have faced and describe how you handled it?

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (North Billerica, MA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Spoke at length with the recruiter regarding the position and my qualifications. Reviewed the JD and verbally "marked it up" with him. As I am not a PMP it was clear this position may be a reach but it was interesting so I pursued it anyway. However, Lahey requires written recommendations in advance and I did not have any specific to this position. I have a lot of experience in project management but no formal training or certifications such as a PMP. So I was uncomfortable requesting a specific recommendation in this area.
Interview Questions:
1. Experience with Exchange Architecture
2. Overall experience in IT
3. Salary requirements

title: Human Resources Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Very Simple, clear & Concise. Got an offer. Phone Screening first then in person interview. Questions were very specific and expectations were stated very clearly. Panel of 3 experts interviwed and then group huddle with actual team.
Interview Questions: Workload related questions, how can you handle stressful situations etc.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Informal. Met with two managers on two different sites, neither manager had a set group of questions. HR needs to get your resume before management can interview you. Had one interview in-office and then negotiated with HR on salary. After I accepted the position HR dragged their feet for a month. After paperwork is processed and a basic physical is completed, you need to complete a full day of training before you can start work.
Interview Questions: Are you able to work full-time? How long have you worked within this industry? And other industry/talent specific questions. I ended up asking as many questions as they did.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Worked with recruiter initially, then met with other individuals with which I would be working. They were upfront about their challenges. I had a single interview after the phone interview. The interview process was pretty straightforward and they made an offer within a few days. I had other offers at that time which was helpful during the negotiation process. It is a very big and busy place which can be intimidating at first.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work with Lahey

title: Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Usually somebody from HR will call you first and then you will have 1:1. There is no base interview process. If director likes you, most likely you will get hired. They don't pay good. They have gone as far as having 1 manager with only 1 employee reporting to them. They will squeeze every drop they can out of you before they look at other options (hiring more employees).  Horrible planning throughout the company. It is a battle to be able to acquire necessary resources to perform your job. There is not enough room here to properly explain how awful this place is. This place is good for you if you want to face the biggest challenge that you could ever imagine, and if you are ready to say good bye to any life outside of work. There is a reason why everywhere you turn there are people looking to leave.
Interview Questions: I heard from a new colleagues it's all about luck, no equal opportunity. Management is extremely bias and shows obvious favoritism.

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: A little miscommunication in the beginning. I was suppose to meet with someone in HR but they never showed up. I then went to the main hospital building to meet the second person and it went very well. I was sent back to HR to fill out paper work and take a mini test. Very simply just easy math. They contacted me about the job four days later, very quick. Y
Interview Questions: What would you do to make a perfect working environment?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The human resources department was misleading.  However, department supervisors were transparent and to the point which allowed me to understand the true nature of the job and facility.  There were two separate interviews that took place on the same day.  The first was with the clinic supervisor and the job was thoroughly outlined.  The second was with the clinic administrative director and the focus was more on the operations of the facility and how individual functions of the department factor into the bigger picture of the facility goals.
Interview Questions: Explain patient care and the importance of patients to medical facilities.

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: HR was very thorough and the interview was a very positive experience.  It was more like a friendly chat between friends.  This helped to alleviate any nervousness.  Once hired there was a full week of hospital orientation, followed by orientation to the unit.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work for Lahey?
Why did you pick this unit?
Why do you want to work in nursing?

title: Registration and Scheduling Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions:
First told about the company. benefits and work hours.
Interview process went well - interview on the same day with 2 People.  
Ask what you like to do. Ask if you mind being recorded and monitored on the phone.
Ask if you  enjoy being on the phone. Ask if you mind having your schedule changed at the last minute to accomodate last minute absenteeism.  
Ask if you have any medical terminology background.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your present job? What did you like about your present job and what do ypu dislike about it.

title: Medical Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview took a long time. You had to meet with four different managers. The questions were basic. I had to go in twice since one of the managers was not there. I received a tour of the laboratory. It took a couple months after I was interviewed before I started working there. You have to get shots and be seen by the NP.
Interview Questions: None. The questions were very generic.

title: Full-time Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: HR department can be challenging and suboptimally responsive
Interview Questions: Standard type interview questions

title: Computer Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth, very personable and highly professional. We went over my job skills, experience, and expectations  moving forward. Very well run interview process was executed. Great experience. Happy to land the position as a promotion!
Interview Questions: Did I have previous supervisory experience

title: Technician/Billing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I've received two interviews from Lahey in the past few years. In both cases, I was given way too long tours of their medical departments (which you don't complain about at the time because it seems like they like you). I was told after one interview that I would be contacted to set up a schedule. Never was I contacted after either interview to even let me know if the position was filled or not. Also, you have to pay and park in their garage too (I wasn't offered a pass).
Interview Questions: I was asked in one interview why I specifically wanted to be a billing specialist. Answering that I was just getting out of school, looking for full-time work, and enjoyed working with people seemed disappointing to the interviewer. As if she wanted me to tell her that calling up insurance companies all day to verify information was a dream of mine.

title: Registered RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was a smooth process. I worked there already as a nursing assitant so I knew the administration I was interviewing with. They were very professional and very straightforward. I was glad I applied and  also glad that I took the job!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come a nurse?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview was set up through human resources.  I arrived and met with two people, the department manager and the person I would be working with.  There was no problem with my being able to complete the requirements of the position.  In fact, the manager commented I was overqualified.  This was a part time position, where I would take a huge loss in pay from my previous position. I was very interested in obtaining a position, but not this interested.  I was told I could work condensed hours, and choose the days. However, if they got busier, could I take on a more responsible project, and hours?  Also, would I be willing to work full time, and if i wanted, I could even work Saturdays.  Then, when I was asked if I would be looking for a full time job, the manager became angry when I was honest.  It soon became evident this was a one way street.
Interview Questions: Are you looking for full time?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was friendly and approachable  They quickly sent me to     meet a nurse manager
Interview Questions: What would do about nurse nurse harassment if I encountered it

title: Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: My interview process was faur
Interview Questions: How did you handle past cinclicts with a superior

title: Patient Access Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lahey Hospital & Medical Center (Burlington, MA) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: 3-4 persons
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?
